items.title: Bug in review() ?
items.body:
Sorry for drive-by issue but:

https://github.com/dpursehouse/pygerrit2/blob/master/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py#L276

Shouldn't that line be `return self.post(`  ?  At least the docstring says that it will return json object..

items.title: SSL certificate verify failed
items.body:
When I run pygerrit2, I get an SSL certifcate failed message.

`Error: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='xxxx', port=443): Max retries exceeded with url: /a/changes/?q=status:open%2520owner:self (Caused by SSLError(SSLError("bad handshake: Error([('SSL routines', 'ssl3_get_server_certificate', 'certificate verify failed')],)",),))
`
For requests, there is an option to set `verify = False`, but I couldn't figure out such an option for pygerrit2.

How do I solve this error ?
Is there an option to set verify as False in pygerrit2 ? If not, should I install a certificate ?

items.title: Dependabot can't resolve your Python dependency files
items.body:
Dependabot can't resolve your Python dependency files.

As a result, Dependabot couldn't update your dependencies.

The error Dependabot encountered was:

```

Skipped pre-versions: 18.3a0, 18.3a0, 18.3a1, 18.3a1, 18.3a2, 18.3a2, 18.3a3, 18.3a3, 18.3a4, 18.3a4, 18.4a0, 18.4a0, 18.4a1, 18.4a1, 18.4a2, 18.4a2, 18.4a3, 18.4a3, 18.4a4, 18.4a4, 18.5b0, 18.5b0, 18.5b1, 18.5b1, 18.6b0, 18.6b0, 18.6b1, 18.6b1, 18.6b2, 18.6b2, 18.6b3, 18.6b3, 18.6b4, 18.6b4, 18.9b0, 18.9b0, 19.3b0, 19.3b0

ERROR: ERROR: Could not find a version that matches black
Skipped pre-versions: 18.3a0, 18.3a0, 18.3a1, 18.3a1, 18.3a2, 18.3a2, 18.3a3, 18.3a3, 18.3a4, 18.3a4, 18.4a0, 18.4a0, 18.4a1, 18.4a1, 18.4a2, 18.4a2, 18.4a3, 18.4a3, 18.4a4, 18.4a4, 18.5b0, 18.5b0, 18.5b1, 18.5b1, 18.6b0, 18.6b0, 18.6b1, 18.6b1, 18.6b2, 18.6b2, 18.6b3, 18.6b3, 18.6b4, 18.6b4, 18.9b0, 18.9b0, 19.3b0, 19.3b0
```

items.title: Missing code?
items.body: You seem to missing most of the code in the repo? just saw auth.py... or am I missing something here?

items.title: When pushing a single json file to a chang edit via gerrit_api.put, library errors
items.body:
I think the response content type sniffing doesn't work if you push a json file. Adding any other file to a change is fine, but when I try to push a json file that ends in .json to a change, I get:

`gerrit_api.put('/changes/%s/edit/blog.json' % changeid, data=contents)`

> ERROR:root:Invalid json content: 
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "checkupdate.py", line 58, in <module>
>     publish_update(output.splitlines())
>   File "checkupdate.py", line 44, in publish_update
>     add_file_to_change_edit(changeid, filepath, contents)
>   File "checkupdate.py", line 23, in add_file_to_change_edit
>     gerrit_api.put(api_url, data=contents)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 179, in put
>     decoded_response = _decode_response(response)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 60, in _decode_response
>     return json.loads(content)
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/__init__.py", line 339, in loads
>     return _default_decoder.decode(s)
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/decoder.py", line 364, in decode
>     obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/json/decoder.py", line 382, in raw_decode
>     raise ValueError("No JSON object could be decoded")
> ValueError: No JSON object could be decoded

However, the call actually succeeded from Gerrit's perspective, and the file was added to the change edit.

items.title: The `_merge_dict` method overrides nested dict
pypi formatting is wrong
items.body: I don't know if this is the right place to report it, but the pypi HTML page formatting is broken: https://pypi.org/project/pygerrit2/

items.title: Add an explanation as to the difference between pygerrit and pygerrit2
items.body:
Why are there two nearly identical pygerrit projects?

This is unusual and it would be nice to have an explanation. There's an note that pygerrit2 is now being maintained, but not why this change was made:

https://github.com/sonyxperiadev/pygerrit/commit/89578cb65abc4cdaa41304663ed9ef206794b681

items.title: 403 or errorless failure to post review?
items.body:
I'm at the end of my rope and hoping I can diagnose what this issue is. I'm using Pygerrit2 to attempt to automate code testing and reviews for a project. The GerritRest API works perfectly for pulling JSON objects, and also seems to function correctly in testing scripts for posting reviews. However, more or less the same script fails when integrated into the production script. Depending on how much of the intermediate code I skip, I either receive no errors but fail to post a review, or a 403 error. The latter is particularly odd as my credentials work perfectly fine in test scripts and I have tried making a new auth token before posting reviews.
I do not necessarily know how to reproduce this but I do not grasp how this could be a local issue at this point. Is there some behavior that could be causing a failure that I should check for? Does it interact with other processes in some way that could impact it?

items.title: netrc usage should be enabled by default instead
items.body:
At this moment if user wants to use netrc he has to add extra code and logic. 

Ideally the library should work like this:
* if auth params are specified, use them
* if no auth params are specified try to use netrc ones
* if no .netrc files are loaded fallback to no authentication

items.title: patch zip-file download error
items.body:
I used pygerrit2 for gerrit download zip-file. My gerrit version was 2.14.7, and pygerrit version was 2.0.2.
I write my test code like the example:
`auth = HTTPBasicAuth('_username_', '_password_')`
`rest = GerritRestAPI(url='http://_ip_:_port_', auth=auth)`
`response = rest.get("/changes/_changeid_/revisions/current/patch?zip"`
But it always raise the exception:

response = rest.get("/changes/%s/revisions/current/patch?zip"%(str(change_id)))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 145, in get
    return _decode_response(response)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 44, in _decode_response
    content = response.content.strip().decode("UTF-8")
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/encodings/utf_8.py", line 16, in decode
    return codecs.utf_8_decode(input, errors, True)
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xe7 in position 10: invalid continuation byte

Please show me tips

items.title: 400 Bad request from Gerrit 2.14.6 using PyGerrit2 from GitHub master
items.body:
Hi, I use PyGerrit2 as such:
https://github.com/agawande/NLSR-minindn-tester-bot/blob/master/src/testNlsr.py#L31
(I am using the latest PyGerrit2 from GitHub master installed using sudo python setup.py install)

I was getting 400 Bad request from Gerrit (2.14.6):
```
args after first merge_dict {}
Posting args:  {'verify': True, 'data': '{"labels": {"Verified-Integration": -1}, "message": "NLSR tester bot: Test Standalone test w/security failed!"}', 'auth': <pygerrit2.rest.auth.HTTPBasicAuthFromNetrc object at 0x7fd069805850>, 'headers': {'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip', 'Accept': 'application/json'}}
Got response
response:  <Response [400]>
response.text:  Expected Content-Type: application/json

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "testNlsr.py", line 176, in <module>
    TEST.get_and_test_changes()
  File "testNlsr.py", line 156, in get_and_test_changes
    self.rest.review(change_id, patch, self.rev)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 265, in review
    self.post(endpoint, data=str(review))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 213, in post
    decoded_response = _decode_response(response)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pygerrit2/rest/__init__.py", line 47, in _decode_response
    response.raise_for_status()
  File ".local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requests/models.py", line 935, in raise_for_status
    raise HTTPError(http_error_msg, response=self)
requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 400 Client Error: Bad Request for url: https://gerrit.named-data.net/a/changes/I5124e9fd49bd9850c904c31d221b42b4249553a3/revisions/7/review
```
```
So under post method in pygerrit/2rest/__init__.py I did:
       #if ("data" in kwargs and isinstance(kwargs["data"], dict)) or \
        #        "json" in kwargs:
        _merge_dict(
            args, {
                "headers": {
                    "Content-Type": "application/json;charset=UTF-8"
                }
            }
        )
```
And then it was successfully able to post:
```
{"labels": {"Verified-Integration": -1}, "message": "NLSR tester bot: Test Standalone test w/security failed!"}
args after first merge_dict {'headers': {'Content-Type': 'application/json;charset=UTF-8'}}
Posting args:  {'headers': {'Content-Type': 'application/json;charset=UTF-8', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip', 'Accept': 'application/json'}, 'data': '{"labels": {"Verified-Integration": -1}, "message": "NLSR tester bot: Test Standalone test w/security failed!"}', 'auth': <pygerrit2.rest.auth.HTTPBasicAuthFromNetrc object at 0x7f9ab8ace850>, 'verify': True}
Got response
response:  <Response [200]>
response.text:  )]}'
{"labels":{"Verified-Integration":-1}}

```

items.title: Stop version-pinning the requests module
items.body: There is no actual need to pin it, and it causes issues whenever a new version comes out.

items.title: Gerrithub: 401 Client Error
items.body:
The example code always give me Client Error back, Same URL via browser and username/password works.

```
from requests.auth import HTTPDigestAuth
from pygerrit2.rest import GerritRestAPI

auth = //REMOVED
rest = GerritRestAPI(url='https://review.gerrithub.io', auth=auth)
changes = rest.get("/changes/?q=status:open+is:watched&n=2")
print changes

```

items.title: Update the  https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pygerrit2/ version
items.body:
I use pygerrit2 lib on Python3, there is a problem that has been fixed on  [c3281b4](https://github.com/dpursehouse/pygerrit2/commit/c3281b416df57b6700b27abbe3f91ed1c22a0071), but the pypi version has not be updated yet.

it is an inevitable problem after calling every restAPI successfully, so update is the sooner the better
